comment: I took him for Math1160. The class is not easy, but he is willing to help if you are struggling. He gives extra credit, and there is homework assignments each week. There are about 4-5 tests & a final exam. He will make sure that you pass the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took him for applied calc and the course is pretty tough but hes a good professor. He offers extra credit and is there to help if you need it. I took the online class and it wasnt that bad

Hes a nice guy. 4 exams online and 1 in class final and a homework assignment every week and a couple of quizzes. I wouldve gotten an A in the class if I came to class for the quizzes, Its worth 20% of your grade! He gave extra credit too.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Professor Minear has such a sweet soul and is a very caring professor. You need to show up to class because Math 1160 is not an easy course but he gives extra credit in class and outside of class. Do homework on time and do well on the quizzes and test and you will pass!

Could either get an A or B in here. He truly wants his students to pass and succeed in life which is always nice!!! His home work is extremely easy to master and is recommended to study for the tests. He does have occasional pop quizzes so its important to study and be prepared. He gives a ton of extra credit during his lectures as well.

He's a really genuine guy that has a huge heart. He cares about all of his students, but he's not the best professor, he makes mistakes during his examples some times. I'm bad at math but with the extra credit I got an A.

I went to class like twice and once was the day of the final, ended with an A+ since he puts all the tests online, the final is in class but it wasnt hard at all, there is homework but it is also really easy. If you want to learn then take someone else, if you want an A take him

Professor Minear is a wonderful human being apart from being a great professor. He gives many opportunities to ensure that the student ends up with a good grade in the class. As long as you put in decent effort throughout the semester, you should end up with a good grade.

It was hard focusing in class because he would get problems wrong. How can I learn from you when you dont know how to solve the problem? The day before a test we had to learn new information about the next section. Too much information at once. Homework due a day before the test is due. Homework and a test every week. Very confusing class..

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Teaches off of power points and examples. He'll work out examples on the board but doesn't explain the steps. Instead of referring to the actual numbers he says, "divide this with that and you'll get that which will get you that." Doesn't make any since right! Homework every week and 4 tests. Very easy class, bad teacher
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Engaging teacher, gave fair exams which he gave good pretests for. If you study ahead he will offer chances to solve questions on the board in front of the class for bonus points, which was a challenging but reasonable way of giving students a chance for extra credit.

Professor Minear is awesome! Lets be real. Calculus is not easy. If you show up late all the time or skip class, you will hate it. However, if you come to class, participate and stay engaged from start to finish (getting your $'s worth), then you will do just fine. Plenty of x-tra credit. His class is not easy, but its calculus. Best option around.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Minear is extremely sweet. But, his teaching skills are really lacking. Doesn't teach the concept well at all, just does tons of extremely difficult example problems. Extra credit is hard to get if you don't understand his teaching style. Has students teach and answer questions, making it more confusing.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Minear is a great teacher! It's evident that he cares about his students and that everyone understands the material. He's always willing to help students succeed. He's very good at breaking down difficult content in a way that it's easier to understand and applicable. We're lucky to have him. It's hard to find great math teachers.

Take him. Math is not a strength of mine, but he does everything he can take make sure everyone who puts in the effort passes. He offers plenty of extra credit and curves grades at the end of the semester. He is very helpful and will answer any question.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Caring, never brings a bad attitude to class, truly loves to teach. His teaching style would benefit students who prefer non-traditional methods. A bit scatterbrained, but he explains concepts so students can really visualize them. Very little homework, short tests, tons of extra credit, cumulative final. Don't buy book, just online access.

Amazing professor! I took him assuming hed just give you an A, since thats what it seemed like. However, hes just a really good teacher and helps everyone understand the material! He wont let anyone fall behind. He will help you as much as you need. Hes great and will do everything in his power to help you pass.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: Great Prof; gives extra credit if you participate in class; wants to make sure you understand the concepts; genuinely cares. Sometimes he fumbles the numbers but that's your time to speak up and get more extra credit. He really wants you to pass the class. Highly recommend him.

Prof. Minear was strange. He never really answers questions asked in class, instead makes other students answer for him. He messes up when doing problems on the board sometimes which is confusing. He is very nice and says he offers extra credit, but it's really just he drops your first quiz grade. He's not bad, but definitely not the best.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: the best and easiest teacher ever. He really cares about you're grade and about you knowing the information.

I just want to say, that this professor is the best I ever had. It is very easy to get an A , heis helping a lot and answer the question even during your final. He gives an extra credit, and all his tests pretty similar to the practice tests. I really enjoyed this class, and liked this professor.

Had Professor Minear for pre-calculus.  Lectures were clear and to the point.  The professor would come to class early and stay after class to answer questions and help with homework.  One of the best teachers I have ever had!

Mr. Minear is thorough in instruction and encourages student interaction in teaching.  Attendance isn't part of the grading criteria, but I wouldn't have been successful if I studied on my own and showed up for tests.  The learning inside the classroom was highly beneficial.  Mr. Minear is helpful to students, knowledgeable and fun for a professor!
